noOfCells.description:
Number of cell(groups) in series in the batterypack.


The BMS needs a minimum of 3 cell(groups) in series to operate, this is a minimal voltage requirement by the LTC and power supply.

batteryCapacity.description: Batterypack capacity in Ah. This value is used for the state of charge indication / calculation.

soCMethod.description: The state of charge estimation method the BMS should use.

cellHardUnderVoltage.description: Worst case lowest cell voltage, when the cell voltage goes below this threshold the BMS turns off completely. This value is a hard limit that is configured in the LTC, crossing this value for more than the 'maxUnderAndOverVoltageErrorCount' amount will make the BMT to turn off immediately.

cellHardOverVoltage.description: Worst case highest cell voltage, when the cell voltage goes above this threshold the BMS turns off completely. This value is a hard limit that is configured in the LTC, crossing this value for more than the 'maxUnderAndOverVoltageErrorCount' amount will make the BMT to turn off immediately.

cellLCSoftUnderVoltage.description: Normal use low current path lowest cell voltage, when the cell voltage goes below this threshold the BMS turns off its low current path output.

cellHCSoftUnderVoltage.description: Normal use high current path lowest cell voltage, when the cell voltage goes below this threshold the BMS turns off the high current path output.

cellSoftOverVoltage.description: Normal use highest cell voltage, when the cell voltage goes above this threshold the BMS turns off its charger input.

cellBalanceDifferenceThreshold.description: Start balancing above this cell voltage difference voltage, stop if below.

cellBalanceStart.description: Balance when cell the cell voltage is above this threshold.

cellThrottleUpperStart.description:
Charge throttle start. This parameter configures the charge throttle functionallity. When for example the cellSoftOverVoltage is set to 4.25V, the cellThrottleUpperStart to 0.2V and cellThrottleUpperMargin to 0.05V a cell voltage below (4.25-0.2-0.05=) 4V will result in 100% throttle, as the cell voltage is rising it will linearly throttle back from 100% to 5% when the cell voltage is at (4.25-0.05=) 4.2V, above that the throttle stays at 5% until the cellSoftOverVoltage of 4.25 it reached, then the input is turned off and the throttle is at 0%.


This is only a signal that is transmitted on the CAN bus and will only work with chargers that implement it.

cellThrottleLowerStart.description:
Discharge throttle start. This parameter configures the discharge throttle functionallity. When for example the cellSoftUnderVoltage is set to 3V, the cellThrottleLowerStart to 0.2V and cellThrottleLowerMargin to 0.05V a cell voltage above (3+0.2+0.05=) 3.25V will result in 100% throttle, as the cell voltage is lowering it will linearly throttle back from 100% to 5% when the cell voltage is at (3+0.05=) 3.05V, below that the throttle stays at 5% until the cellSoftUnderVoltage of 3V it reached, then the output is turned off and the throttle is at 0%.


This is only a signal that is transmitted on the CAN bus and will only work with loads that implement it.

cellThrottleUpperMargin.description:
Charge throttle margin. This parameter configures the charge throttle functionallity. When for example the cellSoftOverVoltage is set to 4.25V, the cellThrottleUpperStart to 0.2V and cellThrottleUpperMargin to 0.05V a cell voltage below (4.25-0.2-0.05=) 4V will result in 100% throttle, as the cell voltage is rising it will linearly throttle back from 100% to 5% when the cell voltage is at (4.25-0.05=) 4.2V, above that the throttle stays at 5% until the cellSoftOverVoltage of 4.25 it reached, then the input is turned off and the throttle is at 0%.


This is only a signal that is transmitted on the CAN bus and will only work with chargers that implement it.

cellThrottleLowerMargin.description:
Discharge throttle margin. This parameter configures the discharge throttle functionallity. When for example the cellSoftUnderVoltage is set to 3V, the cellThrottleLowerStart to 0.2V and cellThrottleLowerMargin to 0.05V a cell voltage above (3+0.2+0.05=) 3.25V will result in 100% throttle, as the cell voltage is lowering it will linearly throttle back from 100% to 5% when the cell voltage is at (3+0.05=) 3.05V, below that the throttle stays at 5% until the cellSoftUnderVoltage of 3V it reached, then the output is turned off and the throttle is at 0%.


This is only a signal that is transmitted on the CAN bus and will only work with loads that implement it.

shuntLCFactor.description: TODO

shuntLCOffset.description: TODO

shuntHCFactor.description: TODO

shuntHCOffset.description: TODO

throttleChargeIncreaseRate.description: Percentage charge throttle increase rate per 100ms (cell voltage loop time).

throttleDisChargeIncreaseRate.description: Percentage discharge throttle increase rate per 100ms (cell voltage loop time)

cellBalanceUpdateInterval.description: Keep calculated resistors enabled for this amount of time in miliseconds. When this time has elapsed a new cell measurement will be made to start a new round of balancing, this all loops automatically and only during charging.

maxSimultaneousDischargingCells.description: This value states the maximum amount of simultaneously active bleeding resistors. This value thus limits the worst case max power dissipated on the BMS trough the bleeding reisistors. The standard value is suitable for the DieBieMS in an enclusure. When the balancing portion of the BMS becomes to hot this value can be lowered.

timeoutDischargeRetry.description: When for some reason the discharge output is disabled (most likely because of a low cell voltage), wait this amount of time before doing a new attempt to re-enable the discharge output.

hysteresisDischarge.description: The hysteris value of the load enable condition. Configuring this value correctly will greatly reduce the risk of load output on/off oscillations.

timeoutChargeRetry.description: When for some reason the charge input is disabled (most likely because of a high cell voltage), wait this amount of time before doing a new attempt to re-enable the charge input.

hysteresisCharge.description: The hysteris value of the charger enable condition. Configuring this value correctly will greatly reduce the risk of charger input on/off oscillations.

timeoutChargeCompleted.description: When balancing this amount of time is waited before declaring the battery 'charged'. The balancing will continue passed this event until no more balancing is needed. This is only to tell the user that it is charged enough to be used again.

timeoutChargingCompletedMinimalMismatch.description: If cell mismatch is under threshold and (charging is not allowed) wait this delay time to set "charged" state.

maxMismatchThreshold.description: If mismatch is under this threshold for timeoutChargingCompletedMinimalMismatch determin fully charged.

chargerEnabledThreshold.description: If charge current is above this threshold current stay in charging mode and don't power off.

timeoutChargerDisconnected.description: Wait for this amount of time before responding to the event that the charger is disconnected.

minimalPrechargePercentage.description:
Output voltage should be at a minimal of this factor of pack voltage to enable the main output switch, this is to prevent large inrush currents.


Putting this value to low will result in a large inrush current because the battery and load voltage differ to much. Putting this threshold value to high could lead to the load never being enabled because the value cant be reached due to leakage current in combination with the pre charge resistor value.

timeoutLCPreCharge.description: Precharge timeout, allow this amount of time for the Pre-charging process. This time also defines the limit of power dissipation in the pre charge resistor. If your load capacitence is higher than 'normal' it might be worth increasing this value to let the pre-charge procedure succeed, but please monitor the temperature of the pre-charge resistor! Normally you don't need to change this value.

maxAllowedCurrent.description: Define the maximum allowed current trough the BMS. Currently current monitoring is not yet implemented.

displayTimeoutBatteryDead.description: Show battery dead symbol this amount of time before going to powerdown in cell voltage error state.

displayTimeoutBatteryError.description: Show error symbol for this amount of time before going to powerdown in general error state.

displayTimeoutBatteryErrorPreCharge.description: Show pre charge error for this amount of time.

displayTimeoutSplashScreen.description: Show splash screen for this amount of time.

maxUnderAndOverVoltageErrorCount.description: Max count of hard cell voltage errors before actually shutting the BMS down. This value allowes you to ignore the occationally crossing of the hard cell voltage limits. This is to for example filter out the voltage spikes from extreme EMC situation (ie. static discharge).

notUsedCurrentThreshold.description: If the absolute battery current is below this threshold start keeping track of time and wait for the not used timeout to trigger. The not used timer will be reset if the absolute battery current passes this threshold.

notUsedTimeout.description: If the absolute battery current is below the not used battery current threshold start keeping track of time and wait for the not used timeout to trigger (happens when the amount of time defined here is crossed). The not used timer will be reset if the absolute battery current passes the battery current threshold.

stateOfChargeStoreInterval.description: Interval in ms to store state of charge information. to reserve flash write cycles please dont make this value to low. Normally the state of charge value is also stored when the BMS is powered down.

CANID.description: The CAN ID this BMS listenes to and leaves behind then talking on the CAN bus.

CANIDStyle.description: The CAN ID style / ID byte order. This is configureable to stay compatible with the VESC style and the style used in an e-foil project.

emitStatusOverCAN.description: Send status information like current, voltage, temperatures and out/input enabled states over CAN. Not yet implemented.

tempEnableMaskBMS.description:
Tell what temperature sensor to use for the BMS temperature stats. The bitwise representation of this decimal value will show what sensor is enabled. The sensor order is as follows:


TEMP_EXT_LTC_NTC0

TEMP_EXT_LTC_NTC1

TEMP_INT_LTC_CHIP

TEMP_INT_STM_NTC

TEMP_EXT_ADC_NTC0

TEMP_EXT_ADC_NTC1

TEMP_EXT_ADC_NTC2

TEMP_EXT_ADC_NTC3

TEMP_EXT_ADC_NTC4

TEMP_EXT_ADC_NTC5

TEMP_INT_ADC_NTC6

TEMP_INT_ADC_NTC7

TEMP_INT_SHT


For example, making this value 4 ( 0b0000000000100 ) will enable only the internal LTC temperature sensor. Making this value 8 ( 0b0000000001000 ) will only enable the ntc that is connected to the STM. When it is 12 (4+8) or ( 0b0000000001100 ) both the internal LTC temperature sensor and the NTC connected to the STM will be enabled.

tempEnableMaskBattery.description: Look at the discription of 'tempEnableMaskBMS'.

LCUseDischarge.description: Use master BMS discharge output.

LCUsePrecharge.description: Use master BMS precharge for discharge output.

allowChargingDuringDischarge.description: Allow the battery to be charged whilst the output is turned on. This would allow you to use the battery during charging.

allowForceOn.description:
When the power button is configured as a pulse switch and allowForceOn you can force the BMS to stay on ignoring the cell voltage inputs. This function can be used to get home in a skateboard application when you know the battery is OK for example a wire came lose from a cell tab of the battery. This is risky! Because you can deeply discharge the battery this way. You can't charge the battery in this mode.


The forced-on method is activated when you long press (about 10 seconds) the power button when the bms is off.

pulseToggleButton.description:
Configure the power button to be either a pulse or a toggle button. The method of reading the power button input will depend on this setting. When configured as a pulse input and with a pulse switch a short press will enable the BMS and a long pres when the BMS is on will power it down.


When using a toggle switch the BMS is turned on when the switch closes and turnes off when the switch is opened up. Please be aware the the BMS also turnes of when it is not used. When it turned off by itself the BMS needs at least 10 seconds of the switch to be opened before it can be enabled again.

togglePowerModeDirectHCDelay.longName: Direct or high current output control
togglePowerModeDirectHCDelay.description:
This function only works with a toggle switch style enabling of the BMS power.


When in direct mode the BMS will turn on the output directly when the BMS is on and turn the output off when the BMS is turned off.


When in HCDelay mode the BMS will turn on the slave load output when the switch is closed and turns it of when the switch is opened.

useCANSafetyInput.longName: Use safety input status from CAN
useCANSafetyInput.description:
In one of the applications where this BMS is used there was a desired to have an extra safety input method to disable the output when there where no messages or when the message states a non safe condition.


The messages generated by an emergency button are received and used by the BMS to prefent unsafe power usage. Set to false to disable this feature.

useCANDelayedPowerDown.longName: Use delayed power down from CAN
useCANDelayedPowerDown.description: This feature puts a CAN device in control of the power state of the BMS. A device can postpone the power down moment of the battery. This can be used to do a gracefull power down of a device. When not used set this value to false.

HCUseRelay.description: Use slave BMS relay output.

HCUsePrecharge.description: Use slave BMS relay precharge output.

timeoutHCPreCharge.description: Slave precharge error timeout, allow xxxms pre-charge time before declaring load error.

timeoutHCPreChargeRetryInterval.description: When pre charge failes wait this long in ms before trying again.

timeoutHCRelayOverlap.description: When precharge succeeds enable both relay and precharge combined for this time, then go to relay only. This will cover the time that the relay needs to close, because relays are slow :).

NTCLTCTopResistor.description: NTC Pullup resistor value

NTCLTC25Deg.description: NTC 25 degree resistor value

NTCLTCBeta.description: NTC beta factor.

NTCPCBTopResistor.description: NTC Pullup resistor value

NTCPCB25Deg.description: NTC 25 degree resistor value

NTCPCBBeta.description: NTC beta factor.

NTCHiAmpExtTopResistor.description: NTC Pullup resistor value

NTCHiAmpExt25Deg.description: NTC 25 degree resistor value

NTCHiAmpExtBeta.description: NTC beta factor.

NTCHiAmpPCBTopResistor.description: NTC Pullup resistor value

NTCHiAmpPCB25Deg.description: NTC 25 degree resistor value

NTCHiAmpPCBBeta.description: NTC beta factor.

AUX0OutputMode.description: Output enable mode for the AUX output.

AUX0TemperatureSource.description: Temperature source of the temperature mode

AUX0CurrentSource.description: Current source of the current mode

AUX0CurrentThreshold.description: Current based output current threshold.

AUX0TemperatureThreshold.description: Temperature based output temperature threshold.

AUX0TurnOnDelay.description: Delay before turning on the output, this could prevent accidental turn on.

AUX0TurnOffDelay.description: Delay before turning off the output, this could prevent accidental turn off.

AUX1OutputMode.description: Output enable mode for the AUX output.

AUX1TemperatureSource.description: Temperature source of the temperature mode

AUX1CurrentSource.description: Current source of the current mode

AUX1CurrentThreshold.description: Current based output current threshold.

AUX1TemperatureThreshold.description: Temperature based output temperature threshold.

AUX1TurnOnDelay.description: Delay before turning on the output, this could prevent accidental turn on.

AUX1TurnOffDelay.description: Delay before turning off the output, this could prevent accidental turn off.
